newsitem.title: USA: Giddings sees possible Q4 charges.
newsitem.headline: Giddings sees possible Q4 charges.

text.p: Giddings & Lewis Inc said on Tuesday it expects earnings for 1996, prior to any unusual charges, to be in line with previous announcements.

The machining and assembly systems maker said, "Unusual charges are expected to be finalized in the fourth quarter and relate to restructuring of our Integrated Automation business, and final resolution of certain contract-related issues."
It added, "At this time the company is not able to quantify the charges that may be taken."
In July the company said it expected full-year 1996 earnings would fall short of analysts' estimates of $1.30 a share by 25-30 percent.
